subject: Anti Terrorism ADMINISTRATIO
body:
Anti Terrorism ADMINISTRATION OFFICER - United Nations.Principal organs of the United Nations. Under the direct supervision of the Director of UNU-INRA, and functional guidance by the Deputy Director of Administration at UNU-HQ, the Finance and Administration Officer will generally oversee the effective and efficient financial, administrative and in accordance with United Nationsâ€™ Financial Regulations and Rules.
Dear Fund Beneficiary.
We have been receiving reports from several individual complaining that after paying for Anti Terrorism certificate that most fund beneficiaries of fund payment like you are being asked to pay certain irrelevant charges by some bank officials, custom department, security and other government agencies, thereby making it very difficult for beneficiaries to meet such obligations which is contrary to Section '37' Subsection 'C' of the Article XII of Banks and other financial decree of 1995 as amended in 1998.   In view of this, the United Nations and IMF have directed the Anti Terrorism department to scrutinize and oversee an immediate release of such payments that has met the requirements for effectiveness without any further delay.
Any beneficiary certified by the Anti Terrorism Department will receive his / her fund within Three (3) working days from the date of the final authentication of his / her contractual date.  Furthermore, certification and unconditional payment release orders have been invested on us and any beneficiaries cleared by the department will not be asked for upfront payment and this will bring an end to your nightmare and long delay in receiving your payment.
Please if you are one of these fund beneficiaries kindly reply with immediate effect with your vital information to enable this department to follow up your request without further delays.
Best Wishes
Ms. Angela Yayra Kwashie
Anti Terrorism Department Administrative Coordinator.

subject: Re:   Anti Terrorism ADMINISTRATIO
body:
Hello Ms. Angela Yayra Kwashie,

Thank you for your detailed message. It's quite concerning to hear about these reports of individuals being asked to pay irrelevant charges by various officials and agencies. I'm glad to know that the United Nations and IMF are taking steps to address this issue.

Could you please elaborate more on what exactly the Anti Terrorism Department does in these situations? And how does the process of certification by the Anti Terrorism Department work?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Kim
